summary:
General Counsel at Koolen Industries (KI) since March 2021.

KI is an investor in start ups, scale ups and established companies involved in the energy transition. KI was founded in 2019 by its CEO Kees Koolen. Kees is an early investor and former CEO of Booking.com and investor and former Board advisor at Uber.  

Louis' main activities are providing legal assistance with new investments and professionalizing the legal processes within KI's majority participations. This covers all area's of corporate, commercial and compliance related legal topics. 

KI's mission is to enable consumers and businesses to contribute to the energy transition. KI does this by investing in new forms of generation, storage, delivery and trading of renewable energy. The invention, development and application of new technologies plays a central part in this mission.

profile_positions.description:
Koolen Industries (KI) is a venture capital investor in start ups, scale ups, and long term investor in established companies concerned with the energy transition. KI was founded in 2019 by its CEO Kees Koolen, early investor and former CEO of Booking.com and investor and former COO/Board advisor at Uber.

My role at KI is general counsel to the Board of KI and legal advisor to the group companies of KI. This covers corporate, commercial/contract and compliance related legal topics. 

KI's current group companies and VC investments include:
- KI Solar (currently selling and installing 75.000 solar panels a year), comprised of the companies BongoSolar, BeStore and Novavolt
- Super B (advanced Lithium batteries)
- SmartGrid (battery energy storage systems)
- Proton Ventures (engineering energy storage terminals and production of green ammonia)
- Floading (smart charging solutions for transport)
- Elestor (eletricity storage system for stationary industrial applications)
- Kraftblock (high-performance thermal storage systems)
- Battolyser (a TU Delft University spin-off combining battery storage and hydrogen production)
- Sympower (system software for green assets)
- Skoon (online battery sharing platform)
- GreenBattery (mobile energy supply)
- EIT InnoEnergy (innovation engine for sustainable energy)
- Hardt Hyperloop (clean transport), 
- Aziobot (cleaning robots),
- Deftpower (smart charging app and cloud solution)
- Dens (emission free energy using hydrozine/H2)
- BrightBlu (smart chargers)
- Greeniuz (infrared panels)
- ParkBee (digital parking operations)
- AmpControl Technologies Inc. (electrical engineering solutions)
- NieuweWeme (manufacturer of charging units and technological products)
- We Drive Solar (EV car sharing and real estate development- and municipal EV infrastructure)
profile_positions.title: General Counsel

profile_positions.description:
ParkLane Insight is the privately owned parent company of TriFinance, a financial consultancy company employing approximately 800 people and where the growth of people comes first, leading to better results for professionals and clients. TriFinance offers temporary support, interim management, permanent employment, advisory services, project implementation or a combination of services. TriFinance works mainly for large and medium-sized companies, both in industry and in the services sector, as well as for banks, insurance companies and for the (semi)public and non-profit sector.

My role at ParkLane/TriFinance was general counsel to the Board and Supervisory Board, advisor to the BU directors and their BU's, member of the Dutch management team, and leader of the legal team of two legal counsels.
profile_positions.title: General Counsel

profile_positions.description:
Dynniq is a technical systems and service provider in the domain of Traffic (ITS - Intelligent Transportation Systems), Smart Lighting, Energy (medium voltage facilities) and Parking solutions (ticketed/ticketless/cloud based). Dynniq combines electrical and mechanical engineering and propiertary software/hardware (ICT) systems. Dynniq works at interurban and urban roads, airports, rail, water, parking facilities and energy distribution networks. With more than 1,800 professionals Dynniq works for nearly 1,000 customers in and outside Europe and achieves annual revenues of around 400 million euro. Dynniq is active in The Netherlands, Belgium, the United Kingdom, Ireland, Denmark, Sweden, Finland, Poland, Croatia, the United States, Canada and Brazil. 

Dynniq was wholly acquired by Egeria in 2015, a renowned Dutch private equity firm.

My role at Dynniq was General Counsel to the Board of Directors and BU directors and their respective BU's, and team leader of the legal team of four legal counsels / contract managers.
profile_positions.title: Group General Counsel and Group Privacy Officer

profile_positions.description:
Thermon is global industry leader in the specialized field of heat tracing technology, providing highly engineered thermal solutions to process industries, including energy, chemical processing and power generation.

My role at Thermon Europe B.V. was principal legal advisor to the executive management of Thermon Europe and its seven EMEA subsidiaries (the U.K., the Netherlands, France, Germany, Russia, the Middle East and South Africa). This included being member of Thermon Europe's management team and of the global legal team. 

Scope of legal work related to:
- corporate activities: acquisitions, governance, restructuring, housekeeping 
- commercial activities: manufacturing-, purchase-, distribution-, agency- and other partnership agreements, tenders, disputes, litigation.
- compliance matters: regarding Thermon's anti-trust, export- and anti-corruption/anti-bribery regulations and policies.
profile_positions.title: General Counsel EMEA

profile_positions.description:
- AKD is one of the largest full service law firms in the Netherlands.
- Advising on PPP, EPC and integrated construction/project development agreements.
- Representing clients n the retail-, construction- and real property sector on contractual claims and liability, both in litigation and arbitration.
profile_positions.title: Attorney at Law

profile_positions.description:
- Houthoff is one of the largest full-service law firms in the Netherlands.
- Advising clients in the chemical industry, retail and construction sectors on their business acquisitions (M&A), partnerships and sale and supply chain agreements. 
- Conducting litigation and arbitration on M&A- and commercial trade disputes.
- Providing general corporate law advice on governance, directors' liability, structuring and housekeeping.
profile_positions.title: Attorney at Law

profile_positions.description:
- International full service law firm.
- Assisting with private equity acquisitions and outsourcing transactions.
- Providing general corporate and commercial law advice.
profile_positions.title: Attorney at law
